Phase 2 (2021-2024):

Model Implementation and Testing

The second phase of project mCODE, named Building Public Librariesâ€™ Capacity for Open Data Services: Models and Implementation (2021-2024), funded by IMLS (NL) #LG-250098-OLS-21.

Phase 2 aimed to validate and implement a theoretical model that we developed (mCODE) for developing public library services relevant to open data, which were developed from previous IMLS funded project (LG-96-17-0184-17).

The project team partnered with 4 public libraries to validate the service model focusing on 4 areas:
1) promoting open data access, 2) providing data literacy instructions for public, 3) developing library programming from open data, and 4) developing internal data capacity for future service development. We continued to adopt the organizational capacity model and match capacity dimensions with the 4 focusing areas.

Figure 2. mCODE theoretical approach

For our implementation and testing process, please see the figure 3.

1

Project Planning (1 year)

On-site visit, Local Training (MOOC), Project planning.

2

Model Implementation (1 year)

Implement the service, ongoing assessment, document workflow, challenges, and lesson learned.

3

Evaluation and Model Revision

Process & outcome assessment, model revision and manual development.

Figure 3. Implementation process
